text:
CLOSE

"Last Man Standing" and star Tim Allen return on Fox Thursday (8 EDT/PDT) a year after being canceled by ABC. (Photo: Richard Foreman Jr. SMPSP, )

The fall season is always a special time for TV fans, with the return of series favorites and the premiere of new shows that could become the next big thing. Prepare yourselves of the coming onslaught with our handy premiere calendar. (New shows are in bold.)

More: Fall TV preview: 10 shows you need to watch

Ryan Eggold as Dr. Max Goodwin on "New Amsterdam." (Photo: Francisco Roman/NBC)

ABC's "Single Parents" debuts Wednesday at 9:30 EDT/PDT. (From left: Leighton Meester, Jake Choi, Mia Allan, Tyler Wladis, Marlow Barkley, Taran Killam, Kimrie Lewis, Devin Trey Campbell and Brad Garrett) (Photo: F. Scott Schafer, ABC)

"I Don\'t (Heart) The Huckabee"--After decades of being banned, Murphy and the team devise an elaborate ruse to sneak her into a White House press briefing. Also, Phyllis hires an enthusiastic college Dreamer, Miguel (Adan Rocha), to help out at the bar, on MURPHY BROWN, Thursday, Oct. 4 (9:30-10:00 PM, ET/PT) on the CBS Television Network. Pictured L-R: Joe Regalbuto as Frank Fontana, Candice Bergen as Murphy Brown, and Faith Ford as Corky Sherwood Photo: David Giesbrecht/Warner Bros. ÃÂ©2018 Warner Bros.Entertainment Inc.
